titles.title: Expressing the sense of Congress that the people of Baluchistan, currently divided between Pakistan, Iran, and Afghanistan, have the right to self-determination and to their own sovereign country.
Expressing the sense of Congress that the people of Baluchistan, currently divided between Pakistan, Iran, and Afghanistan, have the right to self-determination and to their own sovereign country.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Foreign Affairs.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Middle East and South Asia .

committee.name: House Foreign Affairs
committee.subcommittee: Middle East, North Africa, and Central Asia

term.name: Sovereignty, recognition, national governance and status

bill.summary: Expresses the sense of Congress that the people of Baluchistan, currently divided between Pakistan, Iran, and Afghanistan, have the right to self-determination and to their own sovereign country and they should be afforded the opportunity to choose their own status without external coercion.
